thread.title: Cardinals player shatters apartment window with home run
thread.title_full: Cardinals player shatters apartment window with home run

title: Cardinals player shatters apartment window with home run
text:
Cardinals player shatters apartment window with home run Ball traveled some 460 feet POSTED: 27 mins Tweet Denis Poroy/Getty Images 
St. Louis Cardinals slugger Mark Reynolds probably didn't look at his teammates in terror and yell "Run!" but it would have added a comical flair to the incident. Related Adrian Peterson: I could have played in NFL at age 18 
The first baseman blasted a batting practice home run 460 feet through an apartment window, shattering the glass. 
KTVI reports Reynolds was competing with teammate Matt Holiday to see who could bomb it out of Wrigley Field the farthest. 
The apartment renter, David Brown, taped a sheet of paper to his broken window reading "460," or the distance from home plate to his window, according to KTVI. Distributed by LAKANA. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.
